intro: Entandrophragma roburoides, commonly known as the African shea tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Bombacaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and large, palmate leaves. The tree produces yellow flowers followed by woody pods containing oily seeds, which are used to make shea butter. It is valued for its economic importance in local communities and its role in agroforestry systems. The plant also has ecological significance, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
